webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney - Summer Streets on Stanley Street

properties.headline: Summer Streets event - DARLINGHURST Stanley Street between Crown Street, Surry Hills AND Yurong Street
properties.publicTransport: Route 389 buses will be diverting around Stanley St and missing some stops. Check service alerts for info. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Summer Streets - Darlinghurst road closure and clearways map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Summer Streets - Darlinghurst road closure and clearways map

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for the City of Sydney Summer Streets event on Stanley St. The event runs from 11am until 10pm. 

The following roads will be closed from 9am until 11:30pm: 

  • Stanley St between Crown St and Yurong St 
  • Riley St between Stanley St and Francis Ln
  • Yurong St between Stanley Ln and William St (southbound lanes)
  • Yurong St between Stanley Ln and Stanley St

Special event clearways will also be in effect from 8am until 11:30pm on sections of Crown St, Yurong St, Stanley St and Riley St. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

arrangementElements.html:
ROAD CLOSURES

DARLINGHURST

FROM 9AM TO 11:30PM

  • Riley St between Stanley St and Francis Ln
  • Stanley St between Crown St and Yurong St
  • Yurong St* between William St and Stanley Ln (Southbound)
  • Yurong St between Stanley Ln and Stanley St

Notes: * Resident only access from William Street to Yurong St

SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS

Special event clearways will be in effect on both sides of the roads below. Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

DARLINGHURST 

FROM 8AM UNTIL 11:30PM

  • Riley St between Stanley Ln and Francis Ln
  • Stanley St between Yurong St and Crown St
  • Yurong St between Stanley Ln and Stanley St
  • Crown St from Stanley St (western side)
arrangementElements.title: Road closures & Special Event Clearways

properties.headline: Music Festival - HAMILTON Pacific Highway at Albert Street, Wickham
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of festival goers will travel to and from Hamilton over the weekend with two music festivals being held at Wickhan Park. This That on Saturday from 1.30pm to 10pm and Scene and Heard on Sunday from 12.30pm to 9pm.

Local roads around the park will be closed between 5am, Saturday 12 March and 11pm Sunday 13 March:

  • Albert St between Pacific Hwy and Railway St
  • John St between Albert St and Fleming St
  • Unnamed St between Albert St and Fleming St

Local resident access will be maintained when safe to do so.

Ivy St and Fern St at Pacific Hwy will be closed as crowds arrive and leave the festival site on both Saturday and Sunday for the safety of pedestrians.

Allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads as crowds travel to and from the park.

properties.headline: Super Rugby - LEICHHARDT Mary Street at Glover Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Super Rugby: Waratahs v Western Force at Leichhardt Oval. Kick off from 2pm, full time at 3.45pm approx. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Mary St, Glover St, Perry St, Lilyfield Rd and Balmain Rd as attendees travel to and from the event.

Mary St will be partially closed at the oval before the game to allow attendees to safely arrive and leave the venue after the game. Local detours via Chapel St will be in place. Motorists requiring to access other venues in the Park should use either Maliyawul St or Glover St.

Attendees driving to the game should allow extra travel time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: NRL - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Eels v Titans v Storm at Commbank Stadium. NRL Women's kick off from 12pm, Men's NRL kick off from 4.05pm, full-time around 5.50pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

The following roads outside the stadium will close ahead of full-time for up to an hour to allow crowds to safely leave the venue.

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

While roads are closed motorists will be diverted via Grose St, Brickfield St, Victoria Rd and Wilde Ave in both directions. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: NRL - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.fileName: SCO_1080_MOORE PARK WALK_17DEC21_NO SHUTTLES OR EP2.pdf

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Moore Park game day clearway map
arrangementAttachments.fileName: GS_2205_MOORE PARK EVENT DAY CLEARWAYS MAP_V004_22FEB22.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park game day clearway map

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Sea Eagles at the SCG. Kick-off from 8:05pm and full-time approx. 10pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 6pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Fans can access the EP3 Southern grass car park on Driver Ave or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd. If you're travelling in the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit. EP2 Kippax grass car park will not be open for the game.

Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 11pm on sections of Lang Road, Moore Park Road, Albion Street, Cleveland Street, Flinders Street and Foveaux Street.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 3PM TO 11PM

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road* between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)

*24 hour clearways are in effect on the southern side of Moore Park Road from Lang Road to Driver Avenue to support the pop-up cycleway.

properties.headline: NRL - KOGARAH Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street at Princes Highway
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Dragons v Panthers at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. Kick-off at 6pm and full-time approx 8pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium. Local roads around the stadium will close ahead of match start including Jubilee Avenue, Park Street and English Street. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Avenue, English Street and Park Street

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

properties.headline: AFL - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive approaching Accor Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include return travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: GWS Giants v Sydney Swans at Accor Stadium. First bounce from 5:10pm and finish around 7:40pm.

Bingo Loco XXL event will also be taking place at the neighbouring Sydney Showground from 7:40pm until 11pm. 

Allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

From 10am until 10pm on Saturday 19 March the following roads will be closed:

  • Dawn Fraser Ave from Edwin Flack Ave to Showground Rd
  • Olympic Blvd from Grand Pde to Herb Elliot Ave
  • Showground Rd from Grand Pde to Dawn Fraser Ave (northbound)
  • Murray Rose Ave from Park St

Fans are encouraged to arrive early and pre-book parking online ahead of time (available until 11:59pm the night before the event).

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

A-League Men: Sydney FC v Western United at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium. Kick-off from 7:45pm and full-time approx. 9:45pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as fans travel to and from the stadium. 

Local roads around the stadium will close ahead of match start including Jubilee Ave, Park St and English St. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: Super Rugby - MOORE PARK Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor approaching The Sydney Cricket Ground
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Super Rugby: Waratahs v Rebels at the SCG. Kick-off from 7:45pm and full-time approx. 9:15pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium before the game and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

EP2 and EP3 Driver Ave grass car parks will not be open for the game. Use parking at The Entertainment Quarter via Lang Rd or Sydney Boys and Sydney Girls High Schools via Cleveland St.

properties.headline: Festival - MANLY Pittwater Road at Keirle Park
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The By The C Festival will be taking place at Keirle Park in Manly from 12:45pm until 9pm. 

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual approaching and around Keirle Park including Balgowlah Rd, Pittwater Rd and Kenneth Rd as crowds travel to and from the festival.

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: NRL - WOOLOOWARE Captain Cook Drive at PointsBet Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include return travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sharks v Eels at PointsBet Stadium in Woolooware. Kick-off from 5:30pm and full-time around 7:30pm. 

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium may be heavier than usual including Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: St Patrick's Day Parade - THE ROCKS George Street, Hickson Road and Arygle Street
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A St Patrick's Day Parade will be taking place in The Rocks from 10:15am until 11:30am. The parade will start from George St/Hickson St and finish in First Fleet Park.

To accommodate the parade road closures will be in place in The Rocks from 9am until 2pm: 

  • Argyle St Between George St and Circular Quay W
  • Circular Quay West between Argyle St and OPT roundabout 
  • George St between Hickson Rd and Essex St
  • Hickson Rd between Pottinger St and George St

From 5pm Wed 16 March until 10pm Sun 20 March George St between Hickson Rd and Lower Fort St will also be closed for St Patrick Day events. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time through the area and exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on local roads throughout the day.

roads.mainStreet: George Street, Hickson Road and Arygle Street

properties.headline: Beach2Beach Fun Run - DEE WHY TO NEWPORT via Pittwater Road, Ocean Street and Barrenjoey Road to Newport Beach
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Beach2Beach - Dee Why to Narrabeen map
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Beach2Beach - Dee Why to Narrabeen map

properties.otherAdvice:
Around 5,000 participants will take part in the annual Beach2Beach Charity Fun Run and Festival from Dee Why to Newport. Events start from 8am finishing around 1pm at Newport Beach. Changed traffic conditions will be in effect along the course for the safety of participants.

Roads along and surrounding the course will be closed to general traffic. Access for local residents will be maintained when safe to do after runners have safely passed by along the course.

  • Collaroy from 7.30am to 9.30am: sections of Beach Rd and Florence Ave will be closed to general traffic.
  • Collaroy to Narrabeen from 7am to 10am: While the run is underway there will be no general traffic access to streets off Pittwater Rd along the beachfront between Fielding St in Collaroy and Goodwin St in Narrabeen, including car parks/driveways. The speed limit along the southbound lanes of Pittwater Rd from Goodwin St to Collaroy St will be reduced to 40km/h from 5am-10am with a single lane closure in place.
  • Warriewood from 7.30am to 11am: Access for residents via Narrabeen Park Pde northbound. Sections of Peal Place, Melbourne Ave and Narrabeen Park Pde around Turimetta Beach will be closed. Narrabeen Park Pde southbound lanes will be closed from Cook Terrace, Mona Vale to Sydney Rd, Warriewood. One-way traffic northbound only will be maintained.
  • Mona Vale from 7.30am to 12pm midday: Sections of Bassett St, Orana Rd, Surfview Rd and Grandview Pde (until 1pm) will be closed with one-way traffic arrangements in place - follow directions of traffic controllers. Access for residents will be maintained when safe to do so. No parking will be permitted on the eastern side of Orana Rd and the northern side of Grandview Pde between Orana Rd and Barrenjoey Rd.
  • Newport from 7.30am to 1pm: Sections of Ross St, Palm Rd, Myola Rd, Calvert Pde and The Boulevarde around the Beach will be closed with access for residents when safe to do so and one-way traffic arrangements will be in place - follow directions of traffic controllers.
  • Newport to Mona Vale from 5am to 1pm: The speed limit along the southbound lanes of Barrenjoey Rd from Palm Rd in Newport to Grandview Pde in Mona Vale will be reduced to 40km/h with a single lane closure in place.

Special event clearways will be in place on sections of Pittwater Rd from 4am until 9:30am from Narrabeen to Collaroy, and on Barrenjoey Rd from Newport to Mona Vale from 4am until 12pm midday.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

FROM 7AM UNTIL 10AM

  • Frazer St from Pittwater Rd

  • Goodwin St from Pittwater Rd

  • Narrabeen Park Pde between Sydney Rd and Cook Ter (Southbound)

Notes: *Managed local access

MONA VALE

FROM 7:30AM UNTIL 1PM

Notes: *Managed local access

NEWPORT

FROM 7:30AM UNTIL 1PM

  • Palm Rd* between Barrenjoey Rd and Myola Rd (Eastbound)
  • Ross St between Bramley Ave and Entry to Newport BertPayne Park (Eastbound)
  • The Boulevarde* between Myola Rd and Calvert Pde

Notes: *Managed local access

LANE CLOSURES 

COLLAROY 

FROM 7AM UNTIL 10AM

MONA VALE

FROM 7:30AM UNTIL 10AM

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your car is towed, call the Traffic Information Line on 132 701 to find its new location.

NARRABEEN to COLLAROY

FROM 4AM TO 9:30AM

  • Pittwater Rd between Alexander St and Devitt St (Eastern side)
  • Pittwater Rd between Between Anzac Ave and Hawkesbury Ave (eastern side)

NEWPORT to MONA VALE

FROM 4AM TO 12PM MIDDAY

  • Barrenjoey Rd between Palm Rd and Grandview Pde (Eastern side)

properties.headline: Bobbin Head Cycle Classic - TURRAMURRA, KU-RING-GAI CHASE NATIONAL PARK, ST IVES Bobbin Head Road and Mona Vale Road
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Bobbin Head Cycle Classic special event clearways
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Bobbin Head Cycle Classic special event clearways

properties.otherAdvice:
Riders will participate in the annual Bobbin Head Cycle Classic from 6.30am in one of 4 events including a 104km, 80km, 57km or 27km ride from Turramurra through Ku-Ring-Gai Chase National Park and return. 

Road and lane closures will be in place between 5am and 3pm along Karuah Rd, Turramurra Ave, Bobbin Head Rd, Ku-Ring-Gai Chase Rd, Pacific Hwy, Mona Vale Rd, Woodbury Rd, Bedford Ave, Warrimoo Ave and General San Martin Dr in Turramurra, Ku-Ring-Gai Chase National Park, Mt Colah and St Ives as cyclists share roads with motorists.

Speed limit reductions will be in place between 6.15am and 12pm along sections of Mona Vale Rd, West Head Rd, Ku-Ring-Gai Chase Rd, McCarrs Creek Rd and Pacific Hwy.

Special event clearways will be in effect in St Ives from 7am to 1:30pm on the eastern side of Mona Vale Rd from Property No.425 to Kitchener St. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your car is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

ST IVES - FROM 7AM TO 1.30PM

  • Mona Vale Road between Property No.425 to Kitchener St (Eastern Side)

FROM 6:15AM TO 8:45AM

ST IVES 

FROM 6:30AM TO 2:30PM

arrangementElements.title: Road and Lane Closures

arrangementElements.html:
The speed limit will be temporarily reduced for the safety of cyclists riding amongst vehicle traffic at the following locations and times. Speed limit reductions affects both directions unless stated otherwise.

SPEED LIMIT REDUCED FROM 90KM/H TO 60KM/H:

  • 7am to 10.45am - Belrose to St Ives on the westbound lanes of Mona Vale Road between Wildflower Gardens and Narabang Way
  • 7am to 10:45am - St Ives to Terry Hills on the eastbound lanes of Mona Vale Road between Richmond Avenue and Myoora Road

SPEED LIMIT REDUCED FROM 80KM/H TO 60KM/H:

7am to 12pm - Ku-Ring-Gai Chase National Park

  • West Head Road between Elvina Trl and Red Hands Trak
  • Ku-Ring-Gai Chase Rd Between Ku-Ring-Gai NP Toll booth and Kilkari Visitor Centre

SPEED LIMIT REDUCED FROM 60KM/H TO 40KM/H:

  • 6.15am to 8.45am - Mount Colah, both directions on the Pacific Highway between Willarong Road and Yirra Road
  • 7.30am to 10.45am - Terrey Hills in both directions on McCarr’s Creek Road between West Head Road and General San Martin Drive
arrangementElements.title: Speed Limit Reductions

properties.headline: Race Day - ROSEHILL James Ruse Drive at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Golden Slipper at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race from 11.50am.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.headline: Concert - CAMPERDOWN Parramatta Road approaching Victoria Park
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Flight Facilities AIRFIELDS event at Victoria Park from 1pm. 

Motorists should be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area and exercise caution. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching the park including Parramatta Rd, City Rd and Broadway.

properties.headline: Special event - PORT MACQUARIE Hastings River Drive at Boundary Street
properties.otherAdvice:
The Nitro Circus Live Tour will be taking place at Port Macquarie Regional Stadium from 7pm until 9pm. 

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual at the intersection of Hastings Dr and Boundary St as well as surrounding streets as crowds make their way to and from the event. The right hand turn from Hastings Dr into Boundary St will also be restricted during the event. 

Motorists are advised to allow plenty of extra travel time in the area, follow the directions of traffic controllers onsite and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.headline: NRL - PARRAMATTA O'Connell Street at Victoria Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Wests Tigers v Storm at Commbank Stadium. Kick off from 7.35pm, full-time around 9.20pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.headline: Triathlon - JINDABYNE TO CHARLOTTE PASS various roads incl Kosciuszko Rd and Alpine Way
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 150 participants along with support vehicles will take part in the Australian Alpine Ascent from Jindabyne to Charlotte Pass from 7am until 5pm.

Changed traffic conditions including reduced speed limits and short term closures will be in place along the following roads:

  • Kosciuszko Rd from Kalkite Rd to Alpine Way from 7am until 12pm
  • Alpine Way from Kosciuszko Rd to Dead Horse Gap from 8am until 11:30am
  • Kosciuszko Rd from Alpine Way to Summit Rd from 10:30am until 5pm.

Traffic controllers will be on site along the course to assist with the movement of traffic and participants during the event.

Motorists should expect some delays, exercise caution and follow the direction of traffic control.

roads.mainStreet: various roads incl Kosciuszko Rd and Alpine Way

arrangementAttachments.fileName: GS_2205_MOORE PARK EVENT DAY CLEARWAYS MAP_V004_22FEB22.pdf
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Moore Park game day clearway map

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Roosters v Knights at the SCG. Women's Kick off from 12.50pm, Men's kick-off from 3pm and full-time approx. 5pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 11.40am and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

Fans can access the EP3 Southern grass car park on Driver Ave or Entertainment Quarter car park via Lang Rd. If you're travelling in the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit. EP2 Car park will not be open for the game.

Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 1pm until 7pm on sections of Lang Road, Moore Park Road, Albion Street, Cleveland Street, Flinders Street and Foveaux Street.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones even for local residents and Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK FROM 1PM TO 7PM

  • Albion Street between Mary Street and Flinders Street (northern side)
  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (southern side)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road* between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)

*24 hour clearways are in effect on the southern side of Moore Park Road from Lang Road to Driver Avenue to support the pop-up cycleway.
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.headline: Special event - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Road at Chatham Road
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Carl Barron Show at Newcastle Entertainment Centre on Friday and Saturday night. Show starts both nights from 8pm, finish around 11pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the Entertainment Centre.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.headline: A-League - LEUMEAH Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive approaching Campbelltown Sports Stadium
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Macarthur FC v Western Sydney Wanderers at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Kick off from 7:45pm, full time around 9:45pm approx.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.headline: Race Day - ROSEHILL James Ruse Drive at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Ladies Day at Rosehill Gardens Racecourse. First race from 12.25pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on James Ruse Dr and Hassall St as attendees arrive and leave the racecourse.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads in the area.

properties.headline: Police Operation - SYDNEY Park Street, College Street, Macquarie Street
properties.publicTransport: Buses and light rail services may be affected while roads are closed. Check service alerts for the latest info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Rolling road closures will be in place in the Sydney CBD between 1.40pm and 2.30pm for a planned Police Operation.

Closures will be in place along Park St, College St (northbound lanes) and Macquarie St.

Roads will reopen progressively at the direction of NSW Police.

Motorists should avoid the area or expect delays.

roads.mainStreet: Park Street, College Street, Macquarie Street
